metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19528 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.3.7, there is a use-after-free bug that can be caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/iowarrior.c driver, aka CID-edc4746f253d.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1098-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.134').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.137').
